description: Generates comprehensive FDD report with executive summary, EBITDA bridge, QoE analysis, NWC summary, and SPA negotiation points

key_highlights: Normalized EBITDA improved by $264k from reported results
CEO salary adjustment is a legitimate but scrutinizable add-back
Legal settlement appears non-recurring, though documentation required
Personal expenses adjustment is minor but highlights G&A scrutiny
critical_issues: Aged accounts receivable indicate potential collection issues
Payables stretching suggests potential liquidity management concerns
value_drivers: Strong core EBITDA and resilient customer base
Add-back adjustments largely defensible with appropriate documentation

manipulation_flags: AR aging indicates delayed collections and possible bad debts
Payables stretching used for liquidity management—possible unsustainable working capital practices

critical: Significant AR aging raises collectability concerns
high: Stretching payables may mask underlying liquidity constraints
medium: Personal expenses recorded through business account

spa_negotiation_points.recommendation: Base NWC target on an average excluding outlier months of deferred receivables and stretched payables; require post-close adjustment mechanisms.
Require seller to provide legal documentation supporting non-recurring legal settlements and detailed breakdowns for personal expense add-backs.
Include specific indemnities or escrow provisions for uncollectible accounts receivable over 90 days.

price_adjustments.rationale: Discount driven by potential AR write-offs and sustainability of payables management; NWC peg adjustment sets buyer protection against liquidity risks surface through working capital manipulation.

next_steps: Obtain detailed AR aging and analyze historical collection patterns
Request documentation for all proposed add-backs
Analyze supplier payment terms and any negotiation support for payables stretching
Confirm projected NWC levels under normalized collection and payment cycles
Engage legal counsel to draft SPA language for AR indemnities and NWC adjustment
